sentence.Network_en: I prefer to use these rather than a caliper.
sentence.Network_cn: 我比较喜欢用这个胜于校准仪(caliper).

sentence.Network_en: Remove caliper flex hose brackets from the frame rails.
sentence.Network_cn: 从车架的轨道拆卸弯角器折曲软管支架.

sentence.Network_en: Check each crimp ring with the caliper gauge after completion.
sentence.Network_cn: 操作完成后,用内卡规检查每个压紧环.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: apparently an alteration of calibre

entry.def: Calipers are an instrument consisting of two long, thin pieces of metal joined together at one end, and are used to measure the size of things.

entry.tran: (装在腿上帮助行走的)双脚规形夹
entry.def: Calipers are devices consisting of metal rods held together by straps, which are used to support a person's legs when they cannot walk properly.

means.word_mean: 1. an instrument for measuring the distance between two points
1. measure the diameter of something with calipers
